text: It's a decent gaming laptop for the money. Performance is good for most games like Apex Legends, but it can struggle a bit with the newest AAA titles on ultra settings with the Newest Acer Nitro 5 15.6" FHD Premium Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i5-8300H upto 4.0GHz, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10. The screen brightness is okay, not great. Overall, it gets the job done.

It's a decent gaming laptop for the money. Performance is good for most games like Cyberpunk 2077, but it can struggle a bit with the newest AAA titles on ultra settings with the Newest Acer Nitro 5 15.6" FHD Premium Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i5-8300H upto 4.0GHz, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10. The trackpad is okay, not great. Overall, it gets the job done.

Had several issues with the Newest Acer Nitro 5 15.6" FHD Premium Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i5-8300H upto 4.0GHz, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10 since day one. overheats and the battery life feels cheap. Performance in content creation and gaming is not as advertised. Regret this purchase.

It's a decent gaming laptop for the money. Performance is good for most games like Call of Duty: Warzone, but it can struggle a bit with the newest AAA titles on ultra settings with the Newest Acer Nitro 5 15.6" FHD Premium Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i5-8300H upto 4.0GHz, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10. The trackpad is okay, not great. Overall, it gets the job done.

An average performer. The NVIDIA GTX 1050 is good, but I expected a bit more from the screen brightness on the Newest Acer Nitro 5 15.6" FHD Premium Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i5-8300H upto 4.0GHz, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti 4GB GDDR5, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10. It's a fair choice if you can get it on a good deal.
